a.span: Troy City Schools COVID-19 eLearning Plan
Troy City Schools COVID-19 eLearning Plan

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.h1: Troy City Schools COVID-19 eLearning Plan

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

h1.div: Due to the potential threat of school closing, Troy City Schools has created a Contingency Plan to help teachers, parents, and students continue to deliver lessons online for periods of time.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h1.div: Update as of March 13th: Due to the State of Emergency declared by Governor Kay Ivey, schools in Alabama will be closed starting March 19th through April 3rd. Schools could re-open on April 6th, depending on the situation at that time.

h2.div: Meals will be Served at Troy Elementary School for all Students

iframe.aria-label: Drive, Troy City Schools -CNP Parent Notification - 3-16-2020.docx

div.aria-label: Drive, Troy City Schools -CNP Parent Notification - 3-16-2020.docx

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; text-decoration: underline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: TCS Families, Faculty, and Staff,

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: We want to let you know about our efforts to monitor coronavirus disease 2019, also known as COVID-19. The 2019 novel (or new) coronavirus causes a potentially severe respiratory illness. It was recently identified in China and is now being detected worldwide. Currently, there are no known cases in Alabama. We are coordinating with the Alabama Department of Public Health,

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: local healthcare authorities, and the State Department of Education to be prepared with the most up-to-date information and guidance involving the virus.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) and Alabama Department of Public Health (ADPH) has guidelines in place for anyone who has traveled internationally to certain affected geographic areas. Find more resources about 2019 coronavirus through the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: and

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: . The CDC also provides specific

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: . This information includes a list of areas with the sustained transmission of the virus and/or travel restrictions to the United States.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: According to CDC guidance, those returning from China or areas with active community transmission of 2019 coronavirus will have at least some restrictions on their interactions for 14 days after leaving the affected areas. According to ADPH, any students or staff in this group must remain out of school for the duration of this period. On March 5, the Troy City Schools

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Board of Education authorized the Interim Superintendent to follow all guidelines and exercise guidance from ADPH regarding the 2019 coronavirus. This includes any amendments to the guidance moving forward. Parents/guardians, faculty, and staff should notify your schools principal of any upcoming out-of-country travel plans.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: In our schools, everyday health practices remain important. We encourage

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: our students and staff to:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span:
stay home when sick and until you are fever-free for at least 24 hours after
the last administration of fever-reducing medicine.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: practice frequent hand washing for at least 20 seconds at a time.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: cover coughs and sneezes with a tissue or sleeve.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: avoid touching your face, mouth, nose, and eyes.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: avoid being around those who are sick.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Although it will not prevent coronavirus, a flu shot is still recommended for those who have not had one this flu season. Ample cleaning supplies are in our schools and our custodians disinfect high-contact surfaces. Plans are currently being finalized for a meeting in the coming days, among local healthcare and education leaders, to discuss monitoring and prevention of 2019 novel coronavirus.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Families can stay up to date on 2019 novel coronavirus and recommended actions through the

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: and

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If new information results in how our schools respond to 2019 novel coronavirus, TCS will communicate this information to you.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Sincerely,

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cynthia Thomas

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Interim Superintendent
